You're right, a user would typically ask a more specific question or seek clarification on a particular aspect of oil pulling.

To answer your example question:

When swishing the coconut oil during oil pulling, it's a good idea to swish it around your whole mouth, making sure to reach all areas, including your teeth, gums, tongue, and the roof of your mouth. Focus on gently swishing the oil back and forth, side to side, and circular motions to help loosen and remove bacteria, plaque, and toxins.

You can also try to focus on specific areas, such as:

* Gently swishing the oil around your teeth, making sure to get between them and along the gumline.
* Swishing the oil along the surfaces of your tongue and the roof of your mouth to help remove bacteria and freshen your breath.
* Massaging the oil into your gums with your tongue or fingers to help reduce inflammation and improve gum health.

Remember to be gentle and relaxed while swishing the oil, as you want to avoid gagging or discomfort. If you do experience discomfort, you can start with a smaller amount of oil or gradually increase the duration as you get more comfortable with the practice.

I hope that helps clarify things!
